[Scene Items]

The base class which owns a group of connected bones. More...

Detailed Description

The base class which owns a group of connected bones.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzSkeleton::DzSkeleton (  ) 

Default Constructor.

DzSkeleton::~DzSkeleton (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

DzSkeleton::DzSkeleton ( const DzInFile *  file  )  [protected]

For internal use only.

This constructor is called by the Framework when loading from a file so that certain initializations can be skipped that will happen later in the file load process.

Parameters:
file The file from which this object was loaded.

Member Function Documentation

void DzSkeleton::addFollower ( DzSkeleton *  newFollower  )  [protected, virtual]

This method is called by the application whenever a skeleton (i.e. a clothing item) has been "fit to" this skeleton. It should not be called arbitrarily. It is provided so subclasses can override it and customize behavior. The default implementation does nothing.

Reimplemented in DzFigure.

DzBox3 DzSkeleton::calcLocalBoundingBox (  )  const [protected, virtual]
Returns:
A local-space bounding box which encompasses the bounding areas of all bones for this skeleton.

void DzSkeleton::followTargetChanged ( DzSkeleton *  skeleton  )  [signal]

Emitted when the follow target for this skeleton has changed.

QObjectList DzSkeleton::getAllBones (  )  const [slot]

Provided for DAZ Script access. Plug-in developers should use the more efficient getAllBones( DzBoneList& ) overload of this method.

Returns:
A QObjectList containing all bones that are part of this skeleton.
void DzSkeleton::getAllBones ( DzBoneList &  bones  )  const

Fills the array with all bones that are owned by this object.

Parameters:
bones An array to populate with the bones in this skeleton.
bool DzSkeleton::getDrawGLBones (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
A true if gl version of bones will draw in the viewport or false otherwise

short  sectionID 
) [virtual]

void DzSkeleton::postLoadFile ( const DzInFile *  file  )  [virtual]

Performs backwards compatiblity fixes on items read from old files.

Parameters:
file The file that this object was read from.

Reimplemented from DzNode.

Reimplemented in DzFigure, and DzLegacyFigure.

void DzSkeleton::removeFollower ( DzSkeleton *  oldFollower  )  [protected, virtual]

This method is called by the application whenever a skeleton (i.e. a clothing item) is no longer "fit to" this skeleton. It should not be called arbitrarily. It is provided so subclasses can override it and customize behavior. The default implementation does nothing.

Reimplemented in DzFigure.

void DzSkeleton::render ( const DzRenderSettings &  settings  )  const [virtual]

Method called to allow each object to render itself using the RenderMan API. When this method is called, the current transform is already set to the the local space of this object.

Parameters:
settings The render settings that are being used for the current render pass.

Reimplemented from DzNode.

Reimplemented in DzFigure.

void DzSkeleton::save ( DzOutFile *  file  )  const [virtual]

Saves the weld list, the follow property and the follow skeleton to the native file format.

Parameters:
file The file to save the data to.

Reimplemented from DzNode.

Reimplemented in DzFigure, and DzLegacyFigure.

void DzSkeleton::setDrawGLBones ( bool  onOff  )  [slot]
Parameters:
onOff sets whether gl version of bones will draw in the viewport
void DzSkeleton::setFollowTarget ( DzSkeleton *  skeleton  )  [virtual, slot]

Sets the figure that we are currently following.

Parameters:
skeleton A pointer to the new follow target for the skeleton. If NULL, clears the figure that this skeleton is following.
See also:
getFollowTarget(), getFollowControl()
void DzSkeleton::setObject ( DzObject *  object  )  [virtual]

Sets the object for this node

Parameters:
object The object that will be drawn by this node. The node takes ownership of this object and deletes it when it is no longer used.

short  sectionID,
short  pointerID,
DzBase *  ptr 
) [virtual]

void DzSkeleton::setStorablePaths ( const QString &  path  )  [virtual]

Sets the storable paths for the node's object to the given path.

Parameters:
path The subfolder that storables owned by this element should be saved to.

Reimplemented from DzNode.

Called to update any cached or display data for this object.

Parameters:
